p: Two types of antiretroviral resistance assays are currently available to assist the clinician in assessing HIV resistance: genotypic assays and phenotypic assays (Hanna and D’Aquila 2001; Hirsch et al. 2008). But these two tests are also not up to mark as not useful for samples with HIV-1 RNA levels <500–1,000 copies/ml. Table 28.1 shows the most common assays along with their advantage and disadvantages.
